newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU closes probe into British Coal's BCE sale.
newsitem.headline: EU closes probe into British Coal's BCE sale.

text.p: The European Commission said on Friday it had closed a probe into the sale of British Coal Enterprise (BCE), a subsidiary of British Coal, after it concluded the operation had not involved state subsidies.
"The Commission considers that the sale by British coal...of BCE does not involve state aid to the benefit of British Coal or to the buyers," a Commission statement said.
At issue are loans made available to BCE by its parent to cover for BCE's role in promoting the regeneration of Britain's traditional mining areas.
BCE helped create 55,000 jobs by providing workspace facilities and soft loans for setting up small businesses since 1984.

The Commission took the view that the proceeds of the sale of BCE's business funding, workplace and outplacement divisions would cover the loans. The statement did not put a figure on BCE's debt, but a Commission source said the amount investigated was about 26 million pounds.
BCE is one of the last British Coal assets to be privatised.
